## 1. Contact your local council 

You should contact your Local Council immediately if the problem is urgent. Local councils have the power to enforce rules and get problems fixed.

## 2. Consider an emergency court order 

The court can order that the disrepair work is carried out with an emergency court order. 

The court will only grant emergency court orders  (injunctions) if the problem is extremely serious. This list gives you an idea of what the court considers to be serious.

- your house or flat cannot be lived in until the problem is fixed
- your physical or mental health has been seriously affected (or that of someone else you live with) 

You will need to work with a solicitor or specialist adviser if you think that taking urgent court action is the right option for you.
